introductions: Ah!  Detective!  I was hoping to run into you. | I was informed of being a ... suspect in [Victim]'s unfortunate passing.  My condolences, of course. | It is true that wine sales are declining, but let me assure you that neither [Green] nor Green Wine condone ... rebellious acts of the sort. | Officially, Green Wine is completely at your disposal. | Just keep it brief and on subject.
openers: Here for an interview, I assume?
openersDay: I am a very busy man, detective.
closers: You have some things to think about.
Well, since we're done, I bid you adieu.
closersMorning: May the rest of your day fare well, detective.
closersNight: It's shame that we met under these circumstances, detective.  Otherwise I may have ... hired you.
itemYes: That is correct.  What are you implying, detective?
Of course I ... have [Weapon], detective.  Don't you?
I own many things, detective.  Including a company that has a need for [Weapon].
itemNo: It is impolite to ... slander, detective.  Especially when the slander is falsified.
You will have to try harder than that, detective.
itemBut: Since you seem to be ... having trouble, then I will give you the hint you so desire, detective.  [Suspect] with [Weapon] at [Location].
I have a reason to have one though, you should be asking [Suspect] about [Weapon] instead. | You know, like a detective would.
startHintYes: You said [Victim] was killed with [Weapon]?  Something to do that is not ... uncommon. | However, I know that [Suspect] has [Weapon].  Start there.
startHintNo: You said [Victim] was killed with [Weapon]?  Something to do that is not ... uncommon. | However, I cannot think of where to start.  I appologize.
motiveGreenInnocent: I am [Green] Greenston, the vintner of the town and producer of the nationally ... famous Green Wine.  You can call me [Green]. | I am often at the vinyard to the East, but I am often busy.  Take that into account. | This case will hurt sales for Green Wine as much as it will harm your reputation if you cannot find the murderer. | For this reason and more, Green Wine appreciates your ... hard work.
motiveYellowInnocent: [Yellow] is a consistent ... proprietor of Green Wine.  She has done nothing wrong to change that.
[Yellow] keeps Green Wine employees well-fed.  I have no complaints.
[Yellow]'s Bakery keeps the town happy and content, and her smile calms the citizens.  She would do well in both business and politics.
motiveYellowGuilty: I may not be a ... typical believer, but I find [Yellow]'s lack of any faith ... uncomfortable.
Did you know that Green Wine is sold at almost double the retail price at Yellow Bakery? | [Yellow]'s business skill may someday cause her to ... close up shop.
[Yellow]'s kind likeness is an effective seller.  Her lack of control over it though is ... troublesome.
motiveRedInnocent: [Red] has some respectable talent.  If she sold her art on a grander scale then she could make a ... killing off of it.
[Red] seems like a respectable merchant.  Always nice to see small businesses ... succeed.
I respect [Red]'s business sense.  [Red]'s ideas are ... invaluable market change.
motiveRedGuilty: [Red] is surprisingly strong competition to [Yellow] and Green Wine.  When [Red]'s sales increase, our sales decrease.
[Red]'s lack of business knowledge is surprisingly destructive in this market.  I do not appreciate her unearned success.
[Red]'s chocolate sales are adversely proportional to Green Wine sales.  I cannot pretend to appreciate a competitor.
motiveBlackInnocent: [Black] was a long-time ... mentor of mine as a child.  He hasn't the temperment for murder.
[Black] is a solid customer and ... friend of mine.  I refuse to let our differences come between us.
[Black] is the most devoutly religious person that I know.  Despite our differences, I ... do not believe him capable of murder.
motiveBlackGuilty: [Black] and I were long-time friends.  I understand he came to hate me and this town for their views on religion. | I no longer know what he is capable of anymore.
[Black] was not my first choice for town friar, despite our history.  His anger completely betrays his intentions. | I ... sometimes worry about the man.
[Black] seems to have ... lost himself in recent years.  His religious shoutings continue to grow.  I wish that he would step down as friar and rest. | His aging sanity worries me.
motiveBlueInnocent: [Blue] is the reason that [Yellow] has to constantly restock wine.  I refuse to ... complain about my most loyal customer.
[Blue] and I have actually spent some time together.  He has quite the drunken tendencies, but his heart is in the right place.
[Blue] is ... special.  Despite this, his services are much appreciated.
motiveBlueGuilty: [Blue] is perhaps the one person who can make drinking Green Wine seem low class.  I do not appreciate this.
[Blue] is perhaps the least educated person with a say-so in town hall.
[Blue] is the only man I can imagine who can have such political power and drunkenly ... misunderstand how to use it.
motiveVictimGreenInnocent: [Victim] is my personal doctor; he is very ... discrete. | I use- %pardon me,% used him since he could be expedited if needed, and his services are second to none.
motiveVictimGreenGuilty: [Victim] may have been my personal doctor, but I assure you that it was purely ... out of necessity.
motiveVictimYellowInnocent: [Yellow]'s husband was a patient of [Victim]. She seems to have liked him well enough.
motiveVictimYellowGuilty: It's a bit ... tragic really.  [Yellow]'s husband died under [Victim]'s care. | I doubt she really ever got over that...
motiveVictimRedInnocent: They were business partners. | [Victim] brought art supplies and medical skills, [Red] supplied finished art, chocolates, and crafts. | The partnership appears ... mutual.  I doubt that [Red] would kill her supplier.
motiveVictimRedGuilty: [Red] may have a sharp mind about her when it comes to buisness, but she has some trouble keeping buisness and opinions seperate. | Religion can be such a fickle thing...
motiveVictimBlackInnocent: When I brought [Victim] in [Black] seemed to be... just a tad more relaxed. | I suppose it saved him a headache of having to deal with the sick...
motiveVictimBlackGuilty: Their relationship seemed.... strained at best. | I don't think they ever got along... especially with [Victim] publicly denouncing god.
motiveVictimBlueInnocent: Because a visit from [Victim] seems to calm everyone down.  I believe that [Blue] is at his laziest during this time. | I doubt he does not appreciate the ... days off.
motiveVictimBlueGuilty: Unless I am mistaken, [Blue] has an interest in [Yellow]. | Considering the ... interest that [Yellow] has shown toward [Victim], I expect [Blue] to be a bit jealous.
opportunityGreenGuilty: Actually, I was heading to Yellow's Bakery on the night of the murder.  I'd heard that she wasn't going to the party that night, so I was going to ... meet with her about wine shipments, but she wasn't there so I walked straight home.
opportunityGreenInnocent: Actually, I was heading to Yellow's Bakery on the night of the murder.  I'd heard that she wasn't going to the party that night, so I was going to ... meet with her about wine shipments, but she wasn't there so I walked straight home.
opportunityYellowGuilty: I never ran into her but an employee saw her near the graveyard. Who forgets an appointment...
opportunityYellowInnocent: I found out she wasn't at the bakery. Her husband would never forget an appointment. | Apparently she was visiting his gravesite.
I didn't see her at the bakery, but when I was heading back I saw her at the graveyard. | I figured we could ... reschedule.
opportunityRedGuilty: On my way to the Bakery I believe I saw [Red] in the alley. Making her exquisite artwork.
opportunityRedInnocent: I hear she was making her gorgeous art work in the alley | I wish that was the only thing she sold.
opportunityBlackGuilty: I heard the friar say that he was going to have a ... devotional that night. | I had dropped by his church before the party started and saw him in deep prayer. | I have no reason to expect him to move for the rest of the night.
opportunityBlackInnocent: Despite him saying that he was going to have a devotional tonight, I did see him at [Location]. | You don't think he could have...?
opportunityBlueGuilty: Don't remember seeing him in his usual spot, or at all that night, really.
opportunityBlueInnocent: I believe I saw him... At least I think it was him.  He was passed out... | Probably enjoyed my wine a bit to much.
